type.name: section
type.title: Prohibition of factory for manufacture of explosives in or near town.
type.context: FACTORIES (DANGEROUS TRADES REGULATION) ACT under Prohibition of factory for manufacture of explosives in or near town. 3. (1) No one shall erect or begin to erect in a town, or within one quarter of a mile of the limits of a town, any factory or building whatever for the manufacture of any explosive or inflammable substance or thing.  (2) Everyone who contravenes this section shall be liable to a fine of five hundred dollars for every day during which the erection is carried on, or during which the factory or building remains after it has been erected.

type.name: section
type.title: Prohibition of manufacture of explosives in or near town.
type.context: FACTORIES (DANGEROUS TRADES REGULATION) ACT under Prohibition of manufacture of explosives in or near town. 4. (1) No one shall carry on in a factory or building situated in a town, or within one quarter of a mile of the limits thereof, the manufacture of any explosive or inflammable substance or thing.  (2) Everyone who contravenes this section shall be liable to a fine of five hundred dollars for every day during which the contravention continues.  (3) This section shall not apply to the manufacture of any explosive or inflammable substance or thing for the purpose of chemical experiment and not for practical use or sale.

type.name: section
type.title: Rules for regulation of factory hands.
type.context: FACTORIES (DANGEROUS TRADES REGULATION) ACT under Rules for regulation of factory hands. 5. (1) The Minister subject to negative resolution of the National Assembly may from time to time make rules for the regulation of persons managing or employed in or about any factory or building used for the manufacture of any explosive or inflammable substance or thing, and generally for the regulation of that manufacture, with a view to secure the safety and proper discipline of those persons and the safety of the public.  (2) There may be annexed to any contravention of any rule any fine not exceeding five hundred dollars deemed just.
